intro: Hydrangea wallichii, commonly known as the Himalayan hydrangea, is a deciduous shrub native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It is characterized by its large, showy inflorescences that can range in color from white to pink, depending on soil pH. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and features opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas at high altitudes. The flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators and adding ornamental value to its natural habitat.
